website_summaries.verdict: Relatively easy to install, this smart switch is praised for its energy efficiency and widel compatible. If your main interest is scheduling, consider another switch.
pros: App guides you as you install
Compatible with many voice control platforms
Schedule on and off or control from anywhere
cons: Some functions may require a Smart Hub

customer_reviews.title: Worked under the cover of a 2 gang switch
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Easy to install and keep in mind it was my first time ever that I had to change or touch a light switch more than turning on/off the light. My main concern was that in my garage I have a 2 gang switch (one switch for the garage lights and the other for the outside lights) and was worried if one of these smart switches will fit next to the regular switch and under the same main original cover....Let me tell you, everything was on point.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and paired with Alexa with zero problems. I bought this to operate my fireplace by voice. Worked out great. Also, the switch does work with a standard decora cover plate so you don't have to install the gigantic cover plate that comes with it. Fireplace controls are low voltage and the Kasa switch only passes its 120v line voltage through so I used a 120v Honeywell pam relay to close the fireplace contacts. The pam relays are low cost, extremely reliable and have a high temp rating because they are listed fire alarm equipment, perfect for a fireplace.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't recover from a network outage or reboot.
customer_reviews.text: I would love to love this product. But I can't. It DOES NOT recover from a network outage. If you have to reboot your wifi (which we all are suppose to do at least 1 time per month) it will not work anymore. You have to factory reset it and then go through the programming all again, then it is fine. Not that it is hard, just super annoying. Sucks I have 5 of these before I realized this major flaw. None of my other brands have this flaw. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: NFL Fan

customer_reviews.title: TP Link keeps disconnecting from Alexa
customer_reviews.text: When this works, it works really well - lights turn on/off instantaneously via app or Alexa. Problem is, 50% of the time Alexa won't be able to turn it on, and will say "TP Link is not responding." Often as well, when I access it via the Kasa app the Remote Access toggle is set to Disable to some reason - when I restart the app it becomes available. Looks like from reviews that I'm not the only one experiencing this. I'm going to try the Leviton and Wemo switches next, this is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyma45

customer_reviews.title: Works good with ceiling fans, but limited to 3 smart actions
customer_reviews.text: Kasa is a good product. I've installed over 20 switches in my home and they are very easy to install and integrate into WIFI. I have a couple of these switches that control ceiling fans and they work quite well. The problem with the overall product line is that you are limited to only 3 smart actions. Therefore, you have all these smart devices but are extremely limited in how you can use them. That causes you to constantly be reaching for your mobile to turn on or off lighting scenes or other devices. It's truly puzzling and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Invincible Summer

customer_reviews.title: I now have a number of smart plugs and switches from a number of different companies ...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I now have a number of smart plugs and switches from a number of different companies and all work well EXCEPT the TP-Link ones. My Echo Plus is constantly telling me that "TP-Link is not responding" when plugs and switches from other companies seem to be doing fine. Sometimes the Echo will say that the "TP-Link is not responding" but then the light or switch does respond about 10 seconds later. I don't know why TP-Link's devices have to be closer to the router than the other devices to work and even then don't always respond. It's like they need a first non-responsive signal to start listening and then on the next request maybe they'll respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed from the START
customer_reviews.text: I read in other 1-star reviews that it worked for a few days, then failed. Mine failed from the start. I wired it as instructed, and used Kasa app on iPhone to connect it. WiFi light actually turned green for 1-2 minutes. But switch itself didn't work: one bulb flickered, the other never went on (I have 2 bulbs controlled but this, and another in-line switch). WiFi then failed: it kept blinking orange-green (trying to connect), then went off. Not connecting. I deleted the device from Kasa and re-connected, to no avail. It's perplexing that this could be happening, given high reviews... but it is. I bought 2 of these, installed 1. Any ideas - please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Roman Chuyan

customer_reviews.title: 2 black wires to 1 black wire
customer_reviews.text: 2 black wires to 1 black wire There will be 2 black wires on the back of any smart switch you buy. If you live in an older house, there is only 1 black wire in the wall. First let me just say how absurd it is that there is absolutely no help at all for this situation from the manufacturer, despite how easy the solution is and how prevalent this wiring configuration is. Solution: 1 black switch wire to wall black wire 1 black switch wire to wall white (common) wire 1 white switch wire to wall ground (typically bare copper) 1 green switch wire also to wall ground DONE
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to do. Works well
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Easy to install - just realize you need the extra power wire (4th wire) for it to work. Pro: -easy to install -looks nice -has a glow circle to see it in the dark if the lights are not on -connect to both my echo/echo dot/alexa and my google home/android phone (at the same time). -very cool to use voice to control the lights (we use for our outdoor pool lights). -can use as a physical switch for the times you need to be quiet Cons: -none really -the physical button press is a little less "clicky" than I would like, but you now when you have pressed it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Good Smart Switch
customer_reviews.text: After experimenting with a number of different smart switches, settled on the Kasa / TP Link and installed them throughout my home. Physical installation is straightforward. Note, like all of these WiFi switches, they are pretty deep and thus it's a challenge to install doubles or triples into those particular switch-boxes. The software is adequate, and does have room for improvement (the scheduling is not intuitive in my opinion) but unlike some competitors, it actually works and setting up the switches is relatively painless. At this price point, I would highly recommend this product and it work great with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Crummy

customer_reviews.title: Installed 14 so far and planning on 6 more
customer_reviews.text: I've installed 14 Kasa smart switches in my new construction home and am planning on installing another 6-10. These are "rocker" style switches which means the switch depresses and springs back rather than toggling, I actually like that because it keeps multi gang switches looking clean (I have having some switches toggled up and others down). There is a small illuminated circle that appears when the switch is off to make it easy to find the switch in the dark. I use my switches with Alexa and with the Kasa app (which is excellent). The switches are somewhat large which can make multi-gang installation a little bit of an adventure but still do-able.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: works great, but LED indicator
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far, but beware of the LED indicator on the switch. My SO and I need to sleep in a dark room due to night shifts, and the indicator is very bright when trying to black out a room. Some people this probably won't bother, but it really can get bothersome for those of you that want a darker setting. I hope TP Link comes out with a way to optionally turn the indicator off.
customer_reviews.author: KyleButler

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Switches
customer_reviews.text: I had an electrician install three of these about a year and a half ago. It took less than 30 minutes for him to install them, including the time it took me to set them up and connect them to the Kasa app and then Alexa. They worked perfectly until about a month or so ago. Now, at least once a week, they disconnect from wifi, and I have to turn off the switch in the breaker box to get them to work again. When they disconnect from wifi, they are still lit and I can manually turn the switches on and off. I just can't control them via Alexa or the Kasa app.
customer_reviews.author: Shanda

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and works great
customer_reviews.text: This light switch was easy to install and setup. I am a long-time fan of WeMo, having several outlets and light switches ... Kasa has raised the bar for initial setup and cost! I love the lighted circle that shows where the switch is in the dark (when it is not turned on). I wish the circle stayed lit when the switch is in the 'on' position, since my switch is in the stairwell which isn't lit. One word of caution for potential purchasers --- The switch is deeper than standard switches. Make sure you have plenty of space inside the electrical box for the wires and deep switch.
customer_reviews.author: Delphineous

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for modern innovations
customer_reviews.text: Just installed three of these. Not sure why some other brands cost twice as much. Besides that from some of the reviews, stae that the firmware update causes issues. So I wont be doing a firmware update. Besides that, It was so simple to install. The instructions are so clear. Great wifi reception. I can now automate all the exterior lights to turn on at sunset and off at sunrise. No more running around the house or leaving lights on all day because I forget to turn them off. Now the exterior of the house will be brightly lit whenever I arrive home late. Thank goodness for modern innovations. 🙏👌👍
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Romero Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great but slightly flawed
customer_reviews.text: They work great. I was able to set up a routine to automatically turn on the lights in the morning and and when I'm only my way home from work. The only issue I have with them is how much space they take up inside the gang box. If they wired up like a normal switch and didn't add 6 inches of wire inside the gang it would be okay. The size of switch and the extra wire make it hard to fit everything in, especially a double gang box with multiple sets of wires running in/out already
customer_reviews.author: cfhgarza

customer_reviews.title: Wont work with Orbi Mesh router
customer_reviews.text: Tried to install 4 times, but always failed to connect in final step. I suspect this is because of the 2.4GHz limitation, for which most mesh routers dont offer a workaround because you cant turn off the 5GHz network. Really bummed, not just because of the time wasted trying to set this up, or the impossibility of getting support from TP-Link (automated Chat - what use is that?), but because I had had luck with a smart plug made by the same manufacturer, so I assumed these Kasa products worked with mesh networks. How wrong I was.
customer_reviews.author: E. Walls

customer_reviews.title: Worst Purchase ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble getting a working smart switch installed in my master bedroom. This was the 3rd switch I had tried and by far the worst one. The install was easy, it was working fine for 3 hours then it started strobe continuously, I reset the breaker and it kept going. There was nothing I could do to get it to stop the strobe. I was just lucky I am not prone to strokes, someone who is vulnerable to a strobe light could have easily had an episode. I had to uninstall it at the dead of night and swap in a temporary switch until i finally got a switch that worked (Skylink).
customer_reviews.author: V. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy with aesthetics and control
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a Smartthings hub. Originally Kasa was not supported and I often glanced over their products....until now. Setup was intuitive and painless. Wiring was also equally drama free. I use one of these for my front porch lights and let my hub command it as I can set it up to come on x-min before sunset....this is big for me as usually it is too dark before it comes on. So far it controls as it should and all is working correctly. In any instance I need a standard non-dimming switch....this is a great option. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: The Goat

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Wait To Order More!
customer_reviews.text: If you have basic electrical knowledge, this is just as easy as switching out the switch for a different color. Just make sure you have the neutral lead before ordering. I already had the KASA App on my phone so it was a quick AddDevice, then wire the switch into the electric box, complete the install on the phone to connect to the WiFi, and done in less than 30 minutes, start to finish. Now I can control the outside lights from anywhere via the phone app. Or just use the wall switch like you would any non-WiFi controlled switch.
customer_reviews.author: Littlepup5

customer_reviews.title: Unable to install this product
customer_reviews.text: I have installed multiple electrical switches in my house. I have also installed several smart devices in the past. For some reason, after following all instructions, connecting to wifi, getting power to the HS200 switch and the appearance of everything working, THE LIGHTS WON'T COME ON. I have uninstalled, re-installed, tried a different wall switch and no luck. In every case I have gone back and re-installed the good old reliable switch and it works every time. Since I'm giving up on this product, I'm sharing my experience as new buyers are aware that installation won't always be a breeze as some have described. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Great seller

customer_reviews.title: 100% reliable
customer_reviews.text: HS200 wall switch has 100% connection reliability. Unlike the Dimmer switch (HS220), the HS200 switch always remained connected. I have just one HS200. The HS220 Dimmer is constantly going offline (I have seven of them). Don't know why one version has low reliability and the other has 100% reliability . Don't think it's a WiFi problem as computer and cellphone have zero connectivity problems. Also have same problem with TP-Link bulbs, very low connection reliability. The TP-Link HS105 mini-plug (2 of them) has low reliability while the HS110 plug (2 of them) has 100% reliability.
customer_reviews.author: TWBuggie

customer_reviews.title: Great Switch!  Easy to install by a non-DIY female retiree.
customer_reviews.text: I am not an electrician or a DIYer, but I managed to install these switches by myself. Did I make mistakes? Yes! My biggest mistake could have been prevented if I had watched a few YouTube tutorials before I installed the first switch. How was I supposed to know that when the instructions say wire it to a neutral wire that it meant wire it with ALL the neutral wires? Once the two switches were installed, I was able to easily connect them o Alexa. Installation (after I figured out my mistakes) was so simple) I Have ordered 4 more smart switches.
customer_reviews.author: SJW

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and Setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and setup. I was a little hesitant about the light on them but it’s so faint that you just barely notice it. Enough to notice in the dark to know there’s a switch there, nothing more. Also like the fact that it has dawn and dusk settings as I use these for outdoor lights since their cheaper than basic programmable switches. Only downside, of paired with toggle switches, they are a little thicker and stick out more than toggle switches so I had to loosen the toggle switches a bit so they extended far enough out as not to appear too recessed behind the cover plate.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent option for adding automation to existing fixtures
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at a means by which ceiling fans/lights in my home could be integrated with an Echo Dot for voice controlled operation. I finally concluded that smart switches are the simplest, most cost-effective solution. This particular product was as easy to install as any traditional light switch, and the subsequent setup to work with the Echo was incredibly quick and easy. I installed two of these, one for the fan, and another for the attached light, and it works great. I did have to purchase a two-gang plate cover separately though, since I bought two single switches for this application.
customer_reviews.author: P. Zampino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but...
customer_reviews.text: This switch works perfectly and now allows me to turn on my front house lights at sunset and turn them off at sunrise. The only slight issue I have, which you can see in the picture, is the switch does create a minor gap between the wall and the plate. Not a major issue but something to keep in mind if you are particular about those types of things. Wi-Fi communication with the switch is excellent and local control is easy as well: tap on, tap off. The wire leads coming out of the unit are roughly 2.5" and are stranded cable. They also appear to be slight "tinned" with solder.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E Shoesmith

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this was easier to install than a standard light switch! It's been repeated a billion times here, but you do need a neutral wire. This came with all the wire nuts you would need, all you need extra is a screw driver and some electrical tape (as extra security between wire nut and wires). App is easy to use, and I love that lights can be on a schedule. I kept forgetting to turn off the front lights in the morning so they'd stay on for days at a time, now I don't have to worry about it :) Perfect! I will probably get a few more for inside so we can control them while on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K.

customer_reviews.title: Good, Could be Great with Some Adjustments
customer_reviews.text: The installation of Kasa products from TP-Link are pretty straight forward bordering on simple! But, with these in wall switches, there are some issues. First, the gang box needs to be pretty deep to hold the switch and the packing in of the Romex cables attached. Second, the size of the switch itself is slightly larger than the rectangle for the standard "Leviton" switch (see picture). Third, in recent updates to the Kasa app, the ability to see the Wi-Fi SSID and signal strength have been removed. This information was extremely helpful in troubleshooting network connection issues. Lastly, would be great if the Kasa app added the ability to trigger events from the cameras to turn on lights!!!
customer_reviews.author: Big Pole in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Item was defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a brand new item . When I got the delivery the item seem to be refurbish since box was open and damage and looks like someone used before . I went ahead in installed . Everything was working fine till the light was flickering and two of my recessed light burned . I called amazon and they offered a return, which I was ok with it since I didn’t want it . The part that got me upset was when they told me my refund will take 2 weeks . This is outrageous . Beyond upsetting .
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: First one dead on arrival second worked
customer_reviews.text: So I spent hours trying to figure out what was wrong with the first one including contacting Kasa support! Turns out that the unit was defective and Kasa even said that it was. They said they’d send me a new one after I paid shipping myself to send back the defective one! What a joke I just reordered from Amazon and returned the defective one to Amazon. Horrible customer support. Second one worked just fine. I’d give it 5 stars if the first one had worked or their support was better!
customer_reviews.author: JCB

customer_reviews.title: Good Smart Switch for Scheduling Lighting
customer_reviews.text: Was planning on upgrade my house to modern home and smart switch is one of key elements. Overall install is not difficult but you need some knowledge on electricity: Hot line, Load line, Nature Line,..... Quality is good and app control is solid. especially the app scheduling on and off function, fulfill my demand and purpose to buy totally. Not sure about Alexa since I have not enable to feature, but looks like most feedback from youtube is good. the bottom line: no problem to recommend the product
customer_reviews.author: An odinary father

customer_reviews.title: WiFi controlled switch added to Taco 006-B4 hot water circulator
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my application which is controlling my 90 year old Moms Taco hot water circulator. My sister who also helps Mom needed access to the switch to turn on for Moms showers and we discovered their is no sharing option in the Kasa app. On the setup side it essential the installation has a white neutral wire to connect to the switch otherwise it just blinks ay you and won’t finish set up. I solved the control issue by adding the Kasa switch to Moms Alexa account so my sister can just say”Alexa turn on Moms hot water circulator”
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: New router and nothing works
customer_reviews.text: So, we slowly moved over to all KASA smart home devices. Hundreds of dollars. We got a new, faster, internet/modem/router. Everything moved over seamlessly EXCEPT for KASA/TP Lynk. Tried customer service twice and it's useless. We now have 25+ KASA devices that do not work. One minute they disappear, the next minute they are only reachable with the app (as opposed to voice),the next minute they work. All of our other devices we still had laying around work fine. (VeSync, Leviton). Our Sonos system works fine. Our elf cameras work fine. The only issue is KASA, with non-existent customer service. NEVER NEVER NEVER again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christy S.

customer_reviews.title: Can be a nightmare install
customer_reviews.text: Ugh.... what a headache to install in my multi-switch box. The thing isn't the size of other switches. I had to shim the other switches and cut some of the cover plate to get it to fit. A single switch box install would be no problem but adding it to an existing switch box like mine sucked. I'll not do it again. I had a soft plastic plate I could cut. A metal or hard plastic cover plate is going to look really bad. Other than the install it works just as expected and no issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work very well
customer_reviews.text: I have installed a few of these around the house and they work very well. I haven't had any problems with them at all. The only trouble was just fitting them inside the boxes is pretty tight. The first time I installed two in a 4 gang box and it was really difficult to get them to fit with all the other wiring but I got it done. Ideally if you were building a house you would want to oversize the boxes that would use these (e.g. use 2 gangs out of a three gang box). Anyway, they do fit it just takes some care to do it (excess neutral and ground wires tend to be the issue).
customer_reviews.author: A. Sahm

customer_reviews.title: Took more effort than I expected but works perfectly now
customer_reviews.text: It looks great and functions very well once installed. It uses Kasa app so I decided to integrate my bedroom totally through Kasa and downstairs through Smart Life to keep them separate. The wiring in my house is weird and I ended up having to seek advice from an electrician. Installation can be a bit trickier than it looks if your wiring doesn’t look precisely like the illustrations. I was finally able to make all bedroom lights operate off that single switch, or through Alexa commands like I wanted. It just took more effort than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Been wanting to add WIFI wall switches for a while.  These fit the bill perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to put my outside lights on a schedule for a while. HomeKit wall switches are really expensive but these were a great price and fit the look of my existing switches. I struggled at first understanding how to actually wire these up. They need power all the time so you need to pay attention to how to connect it. Once I figured that out, installing additional switches was a piece of cake. Integration with Google Home is also really nice and is easier than HomeKit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Useful, and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the third or fourth light switch I purchase from Kasa. They work well and connecting them to Alexa and google was no hassle. The app is also very well working. I don’t think I’ve ever experienced a problem with it. We can turn the lights on from down the hall before entering our home. Also, if you have a wife like mine, who thinks electricity is a universally free utility and leaves every single light on, then forgets about it, I recommend this product. I don’t know how we lived without it.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great smart switch
customer_reviews.text: Kasa smart switch works as advertised to control a set of lights on a 1-way connection. Remember that you do have to go through the Kasa app and also Alexa app to set it up. Installation a little tricky. I had a 3-gang switch box and the white common wires were hard to locate initially; turned out they were bundled and stuffed behind one of the other switches. Also the adjacent switch was too wide to allow the Kasa to fit, but its metal edges could easily be clipped off. So be patient and be sure you've turned off the power to the switch box before installing!
customer_reviews.author: Alldog49

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Even YOU can install this switch.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little discombobulated with the switch because it could be turned off upstairs or downstairs, however, once I figured it out. Easy-Peasy! If it is a simple one for one exchange, take the plunge. YES, you CAN do it. The extent of my electrical knowledge is single mom ceiling fans. It comes with great directions and if you’re looking at this, you have access to YouTube. All good! 😉 Definitely worth it. Can turn off my kids lights without going upstairs. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Be careful, you will end up addicted to these devices
customer_reviews.text: So, I have now filled my house with all TP link switches, outlets and lights... Their entire library works so very well for our single family 2-story home. Without a doubt, some of the best money I've spent on converting to a Smart Home. From the lovely night lighting in the switches, to the ease of install, fit & finish - the TP Link devices have exceeded all my expectations and made my home so much better. No foolin, just go ahead and buy it, but just be aware, you WILL buy more... and maybe a few more after that. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Shane Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Our new Standard for Smart Light Switches
customer_reviews.text: For any room we want a smart light switch I have switched to these as our standard switch. They are great for a location with only one light switch (can't link them for Two or more way setups.) You also have to have power in the switch box. If you only have 2 wires from the light fixture coming down from the fixture box then this (or most any smartswitch) won't work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wheels in MN

customer_reviews.title: Flawless operation.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two of these switches for around 6 months and the have worked flawlessly. Easy wireless setup via the Kasa app, then easy integration into the Alexa app. Straight forward wiring. Note, you must have a neutral wire; some older houses do not have this wire and the switch won’t work without it. Control by schedule (Kasa app), voice (Amazon Echo), or the wall switch. I’ve had no issues with it dropping the WiFi connection. I would buy this switch again.
customer_reviews.author: DouginNC

customer_reviews.title: Great smart switches!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, takes about 10 minutes per switch. Setup with app is also very easy and smooth. App is easy to use, love the dusk to dawn feature. But would be nice if there is a offset option, for example X minutes before/ after Dusk/Dawn to turn lights on or off. The only challenge is trying to cram everything back into the box after you install this switch. It is much bigger than the "dumb" ones you will be replacing. It would be nice if they can make it so that you insert the wires into the unit itself, rather than having to screw them together and tuck it behind the switch.
customer_reviews.author: A.zhe

customer_reviews.title: May not work with older homes...
customer_reviews.text: We have a house built in the 1940's and the electrical boxes are smaller than your modern plastic ones. This wouldn't even fit some boxes and when we finally found one in our home that would, we had to "feed" the supply wires back out of the box into the wall to accommodate the bulk behind this item. I don't understand why the relays have to be so big on a standard 15A switch. The microcontrollers for IoT of this degree can be crammed into the size of two nickels stacked on top of one another...
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be best for the money...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an intro to home automation. We wanted to have outside lights turn on at night, off during the day. With the Kasa app it was easy. You can choose sunrise/sunset ( I guess it checks the net for this information) or you can specify the time. Alexa interface is a bonus, as is smartphone control from anywhere. Now we’re hooked and have started expanding.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy this brand
customer_reviews.text: I now have these in every room of my house. I love it. My son first told me when he started installing one of them that it was frivolous. Two years later he has now started implementing them in his house. All I do is laugh and smile. Maybe I should tell him I told you so. I highly recommend this brand in particular. The customer service is out of this world fantastic. I only had to call them once after buying 18 of their products. And it turned out to be user error.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Franz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. Started with one (bedroom) and loved it so much i got 2 more (hallway and living room). I’ve got one of those living rooms that doesn’t have lights at all. So, i set up an array of strategically placed lamps connected to tp smart plugs and hooked up one of my smart switches to the nearest electrical box. I then use the app smart actions to use the switch to turn on the connected lamps. Love it. The first thing that comes to mind for additional features is maybe smart actions that allow double pressing or holding for different functions.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew N.

customer_reviews.title: Works well in metal electrical boxes, poor directions
customer_reviews.text: All in all this smart switch meet my needs. I had purchased another brand but its wifi signal could not penatrate the metal electrical box. No problems with this. Negative the directions are missing from the box and if you do not have access to the internet when installing you may have problems. their web site does not idenity which black wire goes to hot and which to load. and it is not marked on the switch. It is indentified in the product pictures which I used
customer_reviews.author: KC Grandpa Tech

customer_reviews.title: Works like it shoudl
customer_reviews.text: I've had plenty of smart-home stuff that was laggy and/or just didn't work very well, but the TP-Link Kasa stuff (at least with the newer versions of the app) is very good. Response to actions in the app is prompt, getting it set up is easy, and the app is pretty flexible for doing things like timing, grouping switches/plugs, etc. I threw out our non-TP Link swiches/plugs and replaced them with these. Do watch for sales, though -- TP Link puts these on really good sales at least twice a year (Prime Day and Black Friday at minimum).
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Google Assistant...I love 'em
customer_reviews.text: I have installed about 8 of the Kasa devices: Light switch, Dimmer switch, Wall outlet; Plug in switch. Once installed, the Kasa app finds them an sets them up quickly. While I like the app, I really got them to use with my Google Assistant. No problem there. They all work with Google. Just note that any of the hard wired products (like the dimmer switch) requires a neutral (white) wire. This is because the wire wire allows the switch to get power even when the switch is off. That said...I am very pleased with all of the Kasa devices.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Except for the style, it's great
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I like being able to turn my lights on when I am away from the house after dark. It's also just a convenience to be able to turn it on and off without going to the switch. Like another reviewer said, the bright white plastic glossy style is not what I would choose, and almost had me deciding not to purchase. Please make it in the conventional switch look, and other tones besides white. Forgot to say... easy to install with good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: DebinNH

customer_reviews.title: Great switches.
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said the HS200 switch by TP-Link is easy to set up and install. The KASA app guides you through installation. I like these switches so much that when we were packing for a recent move I removed all of these switches from the old home and installed them in the new one. I then bought some additional switches. The only issue is installing these switch in a 2. 3 or 4 gang box. They do take up a lot of room in the box so you really have to make sure you move the wire connections around to maximize space in the switch box. Other than that minor issue these are great switches. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M.

customer_reviews.title: recommended ... works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Quick review - this switch is great. It integrates with my Alexa fine and I have been happy with TP link plugs and smart light bulbs. It was pretty straightforward to install, you need some basic electrical skills and PLEASE double check the power is off to the circuit before you begin. I recommend you have a testing tool to make sure the wires are not hot when you start - these tools are only a few bucks. I like the app it uses - allows me to schedule the switch going on/off to simulate someone is home. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M

customer_reviews.title: Measure your box before you buy
customer_reviews.text: These units are so balky you'd nearly need a dual gang box worth of room to install a single gang pole. I only have 2 single gangs in my home where this would be worthy of install and it would not fit in either. The unit is nearly 2" deep alone, then you have to utilize wire nuts to connect it, so you need another 1" of space there. If the design was changed to connect wires directly to the unit, it would be much better off. I had to return, sadly, due to space requirements.
customer_reviews.author: WVU Mossman

customer_reviews.title: did not come with instruction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the name brand TP-Link. I had used a few TP-Link products and they never turned me down. However, this switch did not come with instruction in the packaging. I had to look it up on the amazon site. I had a hard time connect it to my home wifi. After chatting with a technician online and resetting it three times, it finally worked. If you are not an electrician with some computer or network background, I don't recommend doing this project yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Pleasing appearance, easy installation and use.
customer_reviews.text: These are great smart switches that also provide simple manual use controls. I've supplemented them with my Alexa connected home and primarily installed them for exterior lighting I operate with a timer. I am very happy with the traditional look, as these are simple to use as manual switches as well. A guest may not even realize they are smart-switches. I used to have a set with the analog clock and control buttons...but wanted a cleaner appearance. Setup with WiFi and Alexa integration using the App was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Too big for single gang box
customer_reviews.text: Where there is sufficient room for four wire nuts, the switches work well. If you are replacing a switch in a single gang box or a 2-gang box where the other switch takes more than half of the room, you will not be able to fit the large body of this switch in with the four wire nuts supplied with the switch. If tp-link had provided a way for wires to be inserted or screwed down on this switch, there would have been room but the bulky wire nuts prevent the switch from fitting into the box.
customer_reviews.author: DavidS

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and a weird fit
customer_reviews.text: Switches constantly drop from the WiFi and are unavailable to be turned on. This is not an issue with WiFi strength-I have many other IoT devices and none of them have this issue. But all of the TP-Link switches have this issue. For the Kasa app, often it will show devices unavailable and unable to communicate with them. When you try and turn one on or off it will take up to 20 seconds to do so. Meanwhile, if you do it from Google Home, it is much, much faster. Cannot add housemates to the Kasa app. So only you can control the light switches unless you add them to an IoT manager like Google Home or Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: These work perfectly for me and have ordered more
customer_reviews.text: I use these to interface with Alexa to turn on and off lights since I am too lazy to get up and do it. They are easy to install and with the app, easy to get on the wifi. I have had no issues with them falling off the network or working as expected. I do have one that controls the coach lights on my garage and with the app, I was able to put them on a schedule to come on at sunset and go off at sunrise. I recommend these highly. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Will buy more; easy with Echo/Alexa as well as the app
customer_reviews.text: I was frustrated by this packaging at first -- very sparse, limited instructions. However, I searched you tube for a video on this exact product, and found a "how to" made by someone not related to the company, just a user. With that video's help (go ahead and search for it now), setting up this product with its own app as well as to use with my Echo device was a breeze. I can control the switch (used for my outdoor entry light) with an app on my phone (click on and off while I'm in bed), or very easily with Alexa/Echo. "Alexa, turn on outdoor entry." She says "OK," click. I'm getting more....
customer_reviews.author: Krykie

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative for buying smart bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: A good way to start with smart switches. I have no experience in electrical work but it was easy to install and integrate with Alexa/Google home. Step by step instructions were clear. Basic tools are enough for installation. The 2 things I think it needs improvement: 1. The back portion is big that you really need to push the wiring towards the back. No problem if you are only changing 1 switch. Problem occurs when you plan to change 3 to 4 gang switches. 2. The lips are thick that after market switch covers do not fit well. Specially if it's screw-less covers. (I wish they Kasa will make their own 2-4 gang switch covers)
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: I have 7 Kasa devices now and they are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple different brands of wifi light controllers and Kasa was by far the easiest to use and integrate. I had no issues getting the switches on my wifi, no issues setting up schedules in my Google Home or in the Kasa app, and have had zero issues after more than 6 months now with switches disconnecting from the wifi or needing to be reset. These just work and I've told many friends and family to buy Kasa switches!
customer_reviews.author: L. Tschetter

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: Unit does what it is designed to do. took alittle time to get it to work with ALEXA but works well once connected. Did find that there is a line wire and a load wire (the black wires) . First wire it and lights would not turn on or off via wiifi or manually. had to swap black wires then it worked great. They say it doesn't matter but mine did not work, light always on untill I swopped black wires..........
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great Working Smart Switch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shortly after we moved into our house so I could automate some of the lights for the house and it works perfectly! Install was nice and easy (as long as you know the basics of how light switches are wired) and once I had it setup, I haven't had to do much with it! Only annoyance is when I accidentally bump that switch and toggle the light, as opposed to having a traditional switch. But that's not the switch's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The smart switch to get!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best smart switch choice for most people. The product came well packed. Installation was straight forward, I did not use the wire nuts instead I used I-Sure push-in wire connectors. Using the push-in wire connectors, made for a much cleaner and compact installation. I used my android device to pair the switch wirelessly to my router, this operation went flawlessly. Once connected I was able to easily set the switch up in the Google home app and my Alexa app, (Yes I have both!!). The switch works flawlessly, is easy to program and looks great!! I will update this post with reliability in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Sharp Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: A switch that actually works remotely...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Wemo Belkin light switch with a TP-Link Wi-Fi Light Switch and could not be happier. So far the I have not had to reset the link, like had to a lot with the Wemo. Second, I can connect from anywhere as long as I accessed my router when not in my house through my VPN connection on my phone. Remote access never worked on the Wemo. I will be purchasing a second TP-Link Wi-Fi Light Switch for our second home. Hopefully I will be able to see both switches on my phone based upon my VPN access to both local routers. That make this switch really fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Walter S Peckinpaugh Jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for outdoor light timer
customer_reviews.text: Old Outdoor light timer died and in looking to replace it found this smart switch was comparably priced with much more functionality. Easy to install with a bit of electrical knowledge and fits in with the other decora type switches in my home. Dawn to Dusk feature is perfect for outdoor porch lights. no more adjusting the time for the changing sunrise and sunset. Alexa integration a plus. If it lasts as long as my old light timer, which at the time cost more, I will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great smart swith
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go for switches instead of smart bulbs because the switches were more flexible. If the WIFI or internet goes out, you still have the manual switch to control the lights. These switches interface seamlessly with my Google home setup, which is a big plus. I started with a couple of these switches and I was so happy with them that I have now replaced a little more than half of the switches in my home. Even my wife, who rolled her eyes when I suggested installing these, really likes using them. I will be replacing the rest of the switches in my home moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: The Belenian

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Seamless Integration!
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend these smart switches to anyone. Easy to follow installation instructions on the Kasa App. Once they are installed on the wall, the smart setup is very easy and the integration with Alexa is seamless. Clean look once they are installed and also fit standard faceplates if you don't want to (or can't) use the provided ones. They also feature a small, dim light on the front when they are powered off to make finding the switch in the dark very easy, if you want to use it manually. Will definitely return to this brand to upgrade additional switches in our home down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I'm a complete derp
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great. My reading skills on the other hand... Long and short of it is that none of the places I'd want this have a neutral wire, so I couldn't use. BUT! It did work admirably, and provided me a bounty of components when i took it apart! 5 stars, would misread the listing and spend several hours trying to fix my mistake before giving up and using the thing for parts again ❄️🖤☄️
customer_reviews.author: Joyous Mint

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works well with or without app
customer_reviews.text: Seems weird to give something 5 stars for working as advertised... But in any case, it took about 5 mins to install, and all the features work well. Play around with the app to check out features and install, but frankly once set up it has been 'set and forget'. Like that the switch works like a regular switch to turn lifts on and off too - (with inset green light telling you lights are on).
customer_reviews.author: OldSlick

customer_reviews.title: Using these for years, you need them and you don't even realize it.
customer_reviews.text: We love TP Link products. We have their routers cameras, switches outlets you name it. We originally bought these because the front flood lights are activated by a switch in the back of the house... I know right. With Alexa integration it's super easy now. "Alexa turn on the front floodlights", "Alexa turn on the living room fan" etc for get a few lights downstairs after you have gone to bed "Alexa shut off the downstairs" done, simple, the best thing since those old clapper commercial.
customer_reviews.author: USMCSurvivalist85

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking elsewhere -- This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: If you were thinking of getting a 'smart switch', GET THIS ONE. The price is reasonable, the directions are extremely clear, and I can't imagine the setup being much easier. I also like that the back of the unit is 'small' -- so it's not difficult to fit everything back into the electrical box (I've suffered devices that are huge which make it challenging to cram back into the box). It seems to me they have really thought through a number of small details that made setting several devices up at one shot easy. Their App is simple, and the Alexa integration is a great plus. I'm really pleased with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Klein

customer_reviews.title: Used it to power my attic fan
customer_reviews.text: Are you tired of having to walk upstairs to start your attic fan? Want to schedule it to run in the middle of the night when it's cool outside? This switch was an easy solution for me. I had the switch installed and connected to my WiFi in 10 minutes. Integration into Google Home and the app on my iPhone was super easy. Now all I have to do is say, "Ok google, turn on the attic fan" and BOOM! It fires right up. I love being able to schedule when it turns on and off with the mobile app.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Junk product quit working and poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Mine quit working within the warranty period, but they make you pay to return their broken product, which costs about the same as just buying a new one. What is the point of the warranty then? They obviously know their products are cheap, and make customers pay for return shipping to deter customers from making warranty claims. I wouldn't buy from this company. You'll waste too much time dealing with support when your products quit working.
customer_reviews.author: SmartShopper88

customer_reviews.title: TP-LINK needs some serious thinking about their...
customer_reviews.text: Customer support!! I installed a complete house system 3 1/2 years ago and everything worked fine, for the first 3 1/2 years. Then with no changes in my home network, one at a time, each device STOPPED WORKING!! I contacted their customer service (now THAT is an oxymoron!!) and could not get through to a PERSON TO HELP ME FIX IT!! AND THAT WAS WITH A SUPPORT CONTRACT!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY TO ANYONE!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed was included including wire nuts.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to replace a timer system that sort of kept track of local sunset to control my outside lights. It was a beast to program. It had a fixed date for daylight savings time which changed and eventually the battery that ran the timer through power outage failed requiring frequent reprogramming Installed the Kasa switch and a very simple Alexa routing and it all works great. Not effected by political changes in time or momentary power outages.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Jim

customer_reviews.title: I've got a couple of these now and they work great
customer_reviews.text: Worked well right out of the box. When it says it requires a neutral, that doesn't necessarily mean a "real" neutral. What it basically means is that this is not just a simple switch that connects 2 contacts, but requires a neutral because it, itself, RUNS on 120V. In my application I have a 240V transformer splitting into 2x120V pairs. It works fine connected to those, even though neither is technically a neutral. As long as you feed it 120V, it will switch the hot side between "hot" and "hot when switched on", basically. I used it in my water heater controller.
customer_reviews.author: Timmayyy

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The switch was easy to install. It is much larger than a normal switch so you need to take care to be sure there is enough room in the electric box for the wires and the switch. Once installed it was easy to add the switch. I already had two Kasa plugs for other rooms so it was only a matter of adding the kitchen switch. It works well with both my Alexa and Google devices. The Kasa app works well from anywhere I have internet access. It is good to be able to the lights on and off when away from home with and without timers.
customer_reviews.author: Original1955

customer_reviews.title: It's like, a switch was flipped.
customer_reviews.text: And on came my ceiling fan. It was amazing. And now I will get more things Kasa/echo related. I will have my entire home echo controlled, damn the FBI and anyone else listening to me cry like a lonely girl...(i'm a guy). Seriously I have TP-Link Plugs, switches, bulbs, WiFi Extender. TP-Link is and always will be a favorite company. Their items require no hub, Easy to use and set up app, BEAUTIFUL warranties! Can't go wrong. Now, I need a 3 way switch, but the wiring in this house is a nightmare. Wish me luck. VERY easy to install, use, etc.
customer_reviews.author: cdragonm

customer_reviews.title: Love. Love. Love.
customer_reviews.text: Added three to remodeled kitchen. So LOVE these switches. So easy to switch on manually or VIA app. We have the main kitchen overhead light set to go on and off on a varying schedule, along with our Kasa wall plugs for lamps elsewhere in house, to give house a lived in look when we are away for the day or gone on vacation. I'll update if any negative issues (always do) but so far flawless. We've had them installed since summer 2019, Today is New Year’s Day 2020.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good, as long as you keep it away from other smart switches.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to assign the switch a permanent IP in your router, and try to locate it away from other smart switches if you can. If it's in the same box as another switch, you may experience occasional wifi disconnects. Beyond that, this product works well. The Kasa control app is well-done, and the switch integrates well with Google Home. It gets docked a star for the interference issue and for requiring an external server to function. When TP-Link inevitably shuts down the server, they're gonna be dumb switches again. Hopefully that won't happen for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bookman

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I purchased. Price is much better now, I paid way to much for the first two. Either way, they work great, are easy to install (if you understand how a light switch works) and everything you need is provided. Connecting to your wireless is also easily done using the app. Update: I have purchased a few of these now and am still very happy with them. This last one I purchased to control a ceiling fan, which in the app, has an icon of a ceiling fan instead of a light bulb.
customer_reviews.author: James Zawacki

customer_reviews.title: Best smart switch I have tried.
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand of smart switches. They work well. The app and Alexa integration is good. The app is a big deal as I tried other brands with a crappy app and it is a big problem. The only negative I have is I sometimes lose Wi-Fi connection. That seems strange as I have a top of the line WIFI 6 router and a small house. Still better than other brands I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Ken325

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Smart Switch
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these throughout my house for various switches including lights and fans. The install and set up is very easy to figure out for someone without previous experience with electrical work. The app is very easy to use, and the fact it works with Google Home allows me to create a lot of automation and schedules for my lights within my home. I plan to replace more switches over time with these.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I found this item to be easy for me to install and the switch works as described. However, for some reason after the initial installation whenever I manually used the switch it would lose its WiFi connection and I would have to go through the setup process again which I find to be easily done. I solved the issue by manually resetting the switch by depressing the small button bellow the rocker lever and this seems to have solved the issue as I have not had anymore issues with the switch, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Customer consideration needs work.
customer_reviews.text: Now that the switch is working, I'm satified, but tp-link gets an F- on customer consideration. There much vaunted KASA app fails to consider that maybe your installation will be on the same electrical circuit as your router. An easy fix would be a file download of the instructions, but customer convenience, they let you figure out on your own how to install without instructions. That's because their app simply stalls when it can't find wifi. Really, are pdfs sooo hard to make? Or might the KASA app be able to walk you through the setup without a wifi connection?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy to install and configure
customer_reviews.text: the App walks you through the wiring types and the install of the physical switch. once power was back on, the app connected to the switch and it was configured to my WiFi. i was able to set some schedules (this is for my outdoor coach lights without a daylight sensor), and also setup Alexa on it so i can play around and see how it works. going to install a few more in the house next week
customer_reviews.author: Brian Q.

customer_reviews.title: Kasa switch
customer_reviews.text: Love the ways this switch makes my life safer and easier. I can remotely turn on my porch light if I stay away longer than intended. I never come home to a dark house. I also have one hooked up to my ceiling fan so at night if it gets too hot I no longer have to get up to turn on or off the ceiling fan. I don’t have to search for the remote control. Just tell Alexa to turn on the ceiling fan!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: I have now installed these in 5 locations around my home. Most importantly in my carport, flood lights, basement, and deck. All places where I was too lazy to install three ways or wanted remote access. Now, when coming home I can flip on the lights in my dark carport from my phone, or tell Alexa to turn on my flood lights if I hear something outside instead of walking through my house to hit the switch. I have not had any trouble installing any so far and wifi reception is great. This is the future.
customer_reviews.author: David Laws

customer_reviews.title: Good smart switch
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Kasa ecosystem and only buy these products. I like the dimmer version and bought this switch for another use. I am disappointed that this switch doesn't have a removable wallplate mount like the dimmer does. If you don't use their wallplate which I don't, it causes yours to stick out a tiny bit. Why wasn't this switch like the dimmee I bought earlier?
customer_reviews.author: Morning

customer_reviews.title: Decent remote light switch
customer_reviews.text: Decent light switch. My first. Works remotely so that what I like. Would be better if it worked with Siri and home, but can control with Alexa and other Kasa app or widget in iOS. Easy to use but may take some time to get used to install and set up at first. Only con would be the light when it’s off but I use it with a fan so I keep it on turn off using the fan remote. Has a great wake up or sleep feature for each day or if you travel.
customer_reviews.author: Timetogetill7

customer_reviews.title: Believe the Reviews that Say...
customer_reviews.text: 1. It works - I just say "Alexa, turn on House Fan" and it goes on! 2. The wires are a tight fit in the electrical box 3. You do need to have the right combo of wires (or in my case I didn't have the right combo, I got some advice from an electrician which works and is safe, but I'm not sharing that because I don't want to be responsible for causing problems) 4. If you go to turn it on manually, just know it's not like a regular light switch, it's more like an on/off button.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Farmer with an M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking switch that was very easy to install. I was a little nervous when no instructions came with the switch but once I downloaded the app it had a step by step installation program in the app that made it very simple to fallow. My only complaint is the app is slow when loading to turn the switch on and off with you mobile device. Speed up the app and this switch will be perfect. I will be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: The TP-Link HS200 works great. Just take your time installing the wires as per the colors. The app works great and easy to follow. Connection to Amazon Alexa is also very easy and works all the time. I have installed 4 switches so far of the HS200 and they all work great. I am happy so far after 10 days of using the product. If you have issues with installation, search YouTube and you will find a lot of videos on how to install.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I've setup quite a few other Smart Home products and I have to say, this was very easy. I'm good with home electrical work so this was a breeze. Like the description mentions, you need a "White" neutral wire to tap into. The device isn't as deep as a GFCI device so, no problems. Kasa app on Android was too simple! I didn't notice any lag as others mentioned. Maybe cuz I have an awesome Galaxy S10+. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: Kasa Smart Light Switch by TP-Link is a fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I installed 6 of these last year and should have gone to these first this time, but no - I decided to change to a cheaper smart switch where 2 costs the same as one of these. Tried the cheaper switches and neither worked, so returned them and ordered another pair. Ultimately, I spent 8 hours before I gave up on the cheap switches after 5 didn't work. I then ordered 2 Kasa Smart Light Switches by TP-Link, they both worked, spent 15 minutest installing both of them and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Got one to control my porch light, and the other that controls the two lights on either side of my garage outside. Easy to install, fit in the standard box. One of them I used the faceplate that comes with it, the other did not as it is in a group of three switches where I have a cover with three openings. Fits in perfectly! I have both integrated with Alexa to turn on and off based on a schedule.
customer_reviews.author: elenaballlesteros

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Installation was pretty damn simple. Just be aware that it's larger than standard light switches and with the additional wires, it can take some work to get more than one (or sometimes even one) of these to fit. Works with my Google Home just fine. Wife is loving it. For anyone who cares, I replaced the switch for the bathroom vent and it works there just fine, too. It knows when it should be on or off, unlike the first generation of smart light switches. Can't say anything bad about it after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: TL

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart Light Switch by TP-Link, Single Pole, Needs Neutral Wire, 2.4Ghz WiFi Light Switch Works with Alexa and Google Assistant, UL Certified, 1-Pack (HS200), White
product_meta.description: Style:Smart Light SwitchControl your lights, ceiling fans, and other fixtures from anywhere with the Kasa Smart Wi Fi Light Switch. The smart switch replaces any standard light switch, and connects to your home Wi Fi in no time through the free Kasa app. Kasa also lets you manage connected fixtures with your smartphone or tablet, including setting schedules, timers and countdowns. For added convenience, you can use your voice to control when paired with Amazon Alexa, Google assistant and Microsoft Cortana. Protocols supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n; System requirement: Android 4.1 or higher iOS 9.0 or higher; Wireless type: 2.4GHz 1T1R.
feature_bullets: Easy guided install: Neutral wire is required, standard wall plate size. No need to understand complex switch wiring or master vs auxiliary switch configurations; The Kasa app guides you through easy step by step installation. Need 2.4GHz Wi-Fi connection
Control from anywhere: Monitor your light status. Turn electronics on and off from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa app, whether you are at home, in the office or on vacation

Voice control: Enjoy the hands-free convenience of controlling the lights in your home with your voice via Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant; perfect for times when your hands are full or entering a dark room

Scheduling: Use timer or countdown schedules to set your smart switch to automatically turn on and off while you're home or away. Enable ‘away mode’ to randomly switch on and off to trick potential intruders
Trusted and reliable: Designed and developed in silicon valley, Kasa is trusted by over 4 million users. UL certified for safety use. 2-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars9,139 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
